BitField.name: HSION
BitField.description: HSI16 clock enable Set and cleared by software. Cleared by hardware to stop the HSI16 oscillator when entering Stop, Standby or Shutdown mode. Set by hardware to force the HSI16 oscillator ON when STOPWUCK=1 or HSIASFS = 1 when leaving Stop modes, or in case of failure of the HSE crystal oscillator. This bit is set by hardware if the HSI16 is used directly or indirectly as system clock.

BitField.name: HSIKERON
BitField.description: HSI16 always enable for peripheral kernels. Set and cleared by software to force HSI16 ON even in Stop modes. The HSI16 can only feed USARTs and I<sup>2</sup>Cs peripherals configured with HSI16 as kernel clock. Keeping the HSI16 ON in Stop mode allows to avoid slowing down the communication speed because of the HSI16 startup time. This bit has no effect on HSION value.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSI16 oscillator is forced ON even in Stop mode.

BitField.name: HSIRDY
BitField.description: HSI16 clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that HSI16 oscillator is stable. This bit is set only when HSI16 is enabled by software by setting HSION. Note: Once the HSION bit is cleared, HSIRDY goes low after 6 HSI16 clock cycles.

BitField.name: HSEON
BitField.description: HSE clock enable Set and cleared by software. Cleared by hardware to stop the HSE oscillator when entering Stop, Standby or Shutdown mode. This bit cannot be reset if the HSE oscillator is used directly or indirectly as the system clock.

BitField.name: HSERDY
BitField.description: HSE clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the HSE oscillator is stable. Note: Once the HSEON bit is cleared, HSERDY goes low after 6 HSE clock cycles.

BitField.name: HSEBYP
BitField.description: HSE crystal oscillator bypass Set and cleared by software to bypass the oscillator with an external clock. The external clock must be enabled with the HSEON bit set, to be used by the device. The HSEBYP bit can be written only if the HSE oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSE crystal oscillator bypassed with external clock

BitField.name: CSSON
BitField.description: Clock security system enable Set by software to enable the clock security system. When CSSON is set, the clock detector is enabled by hardware when the HSE oscillator is ready, and disabled by hardware if a HSE clock failure is detected. This bit is set only and is cleared by reset.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Clock security system OFF (clock detector OFF)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock security system ON (Clock detector ON if the HSE oscillator is stable, OFF if not).

BitField.name: PLLON
BitField.description: Main PLL enable Set and cleared by software to enable the main PLL. Cleared by hardware when entering Stop, Standby or Shutdown mode. This bit cannot be reset if the PLL clock is used as the system clock.

BitField.name: PLLRDY
BitField.description: Main PLL clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the main PLL is locked.

BitField.name: HSICAL
BitField.description: HSI16 clock calibration These bits are initialized at startup with the factory-programmed HSI16 calibration trim value. When HSITRIM is written, HSICAL is updated with the sum of HSITRIM and the factory trim value.

BitField.name: HSITRIM
BitField.description: HSI16 clock trimming These bits provide an additional user-programmable trimming value that is added to the HSICAL[7:0] bits. It can be programmed to adjust to variations in voltage and temperature that influence the frequency of the HSI16. The default value is 16, which, when added to the HSICAL value, should trim the HSI16 to 16 MHz ï¿½ 1 %.

BitField.name: SW
BitField.description: System clock switch Set and cleared by software to select system clock source (SYSCLK). Configured by hardware to force HSI16 oscillator selection when exiting stop and standby modes or in case of failure of the HSE oscillator.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Reserved, must be kept at reset value

BitField.name: SWS
BitField.description: System clock switch status Set and cleared by hardware to indicate which clock source is used as system clock.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Reserved, must be kept at reset value

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSI16 oscillator used as system clock

BitField.name: HPRE
BitField.description: AHB prescaler Set and cleared by software to control the division factor of the AHB clock. Note: Depending on the device voltage range, the software has to set correctly these bits to ensure that the system frequency does not exceed the maximum allowed frequency (for more details please refer to Section 6.1.5: Dynamic voltage scaling management). After a write operation to these bits and before decreasing the voltage range, this register must be read to be sure that the new value has been taken into account. 0xxx: SYSCLK not divided

BitField.name: PPRE1
BitField.description: APB1 prescaler Set and cleared by software to control the division factor of the APB1 clock (PCLK1). 0xx: HCLK not divided

BitField.name: PPRE2
BitField.description: APB2 prescaler Set and cleared by software to control the division factor of the APB2 clock (PCLK2). 0xx: HCLK not divided

BitField.name: MCOSEL
BitField.description: Microcontroller clock output Set and cleared by software. Others: Reserved Note: This clock output may have some truncated cycles at startup or during MCO clock source switching.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: MCO output disabled, no clock on MCO

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Reserved, must be kept at reset value

BitField.name: MCOPRE
BitField.description: Microcontroller clock output prescaler These bits are set and cleared by software. It is highly recommended to change this prescaler before MCO output is enabled. Others: not allowed

BitField.name: PLLSRC
BitField.description: Main PLL entry clock source Set and cleared by software to select PLL clock source. These bits can be written only when PLL is disabled. In order to save power, when no PLL is used, the value of PLLSRC should be 00.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: HSI16 clock selected as PLL clock entry

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: HSE clock selected as PLL clock entry

BitField.name: PLLM
BitField.description: Division factor for the main PLL input clock Set and cleared by software to divide the PLL input clock before the VCO. These bits can be written only when all PLLs are disabled. VCO input frequency = PLL input clock frequency / PLLM with 1 <= PLLM <= 16 ... Note: The software has to set these bits correctly to ensure that the VCO input frequency is within the range defined in the device datasheet.

BitField.name: PLLN
BitField.description: Main PLL multiplication factor for VCO Set and cleared by software to control the multiplication factor of the VCO. These bits can be written only when the PLL is disabled. VCO output frequency = VCO input frequency x PLLN with 8 =< PLLN =< 127 ... ... Note: The software has to set correctly these bits to assure that the VCO output frequency is within the range defined in the device datasheet.

BitField.name: PLLPEN
BitField.description: Main PLL PLL â€œPâ€ clock output enable Set and reset by software to enable the PLL â€œPâ€ clock output of the PLL. In order to save power, when the PLL â€œPâ€ clock output of the PLL is not used, the value of PLLPEN should be 0.

BitField.name: PLLP
BitField.description: Main PLL division factor for PLL â€œPâ€ clock. Set and cleared by software to control the frequency of the main PLL output clock PLL â€œPâ€ clock. These bits can be written only if PLL is disabled. When the PLLPDIV[4:0] is set to â€œ00000â€PLL â€œPâ€ output clock frequency = VCO frequency / PLLP with PLLP =7, or 17 Note: The software has to set these bits correctly not to exceed 170 MHz on this domain.

BitField.name: PLLQEN
BitField.description: Main PLL â€œQâ€ clock output enable Set and reset by software to enable the PLL â€œQâ€ clock output of the PLL. In order to save power, when the PLL â€œQâ€ clock output of the PLL is not used, the value of PLLQEN should be 0.

BitField.name: PLLQ
BitField.description: Main PLL division factor for PLL â€œQâ€ clock. Set and cleared by software to control the frequency of the main PLL output clock PLL â€œQâ€ clock. This output can be selected for USB, RNG, SAI (48 MHz clock). These bits can be written only if PLL is disabled. PLL â€œQâ€ output clock frequency = VCO frequency / PLLQ with PLLQ = 2, 4, 6, or 8 Note: The software has to set these bits correctly not to exceed 170 MHz on this domain.

BitField.name: PLLREN
BitField.description: PLL â€œRâ€ clock output enable Set and reset by software to enable the PLL â€œRâ€ clock output of the PLL (used as system clock). This bit cannot be written when PLL â€œRâ€ clock output of the PLL is used as System Clock. In order to save power, when the PLL â€œRâ€ clock output of the PLL is not used, the value of PLLREN should be 0.

BitField.name: PLLR
BitField.description: Main PLL division factor for PLL â€œRâ€ clock (system clock) Set and cleared by software to control the frequency of the main PLL output clock PLLCLK. This output can be selected as system clock. These bits can be written only if PLL is disabled. PLL â€œRâ€ output clock frequency = VCO frequency / PLLR with PLLR = 2, 4, 6, or 8 Note: The software has to set these bits correctly not to exceed 170 MHz on this domain.

BitField.name: PLLPDIV
BitField.description: Main PLLP division factor Set and cleared by software to control the PLL â€œPâ€ frequency. PLL â€œPâ€ output clock frequency = VCO frequency / PLLPDIV. ....

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL â€œPâ€ clock is controlled by the bit PLLP

BitField.name: LSIRDYIE
BitField.description: LSI ready interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the LSI oscillator stabilization.

BitField.name: LSERDYIE
BitField.description: LSE ready interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the LSE oscillator stabilization.

BitField.name: HSIRDYIE
BitField.description: HSI16 ready interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the HSI16 oscillator stabilization.

BitField.name: HSERDYIE
BitField.description: HSE ready interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the HSE oscillator stabilization.

BitField.name: PLLRDYIE
BitField.description: PLL ready interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by PLL lock.

BitField.name: LSECSSIE
BitField.description: LSE clock security system interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the clock security system on LSE.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Clock security interrupt caused by LSE clock failure disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock security interrupt caused by LSE clock failure enabled

BitField.name: HSI48RDYIE
BitField.description: HSI48 ready interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by the internal HSI48 oscillator.

BitField.name: LSIRDYF
BitField.description: LSI ready interrupt flag Set by hardware when the LSI clock becomes stable and LSIRDYDIE is set. Cleared by software setting the LSIRDYC bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No clock ready interrupt caused by the LSI oscillator

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock ready interrupt caused by the LSI oscillator

BitField.name: LSERDYF
BitField.description: LSE ready interrupt flag Set by hardware when the LSE clock becomes stable and LSERDYDIE is set. Cleared by software setting the LSERDYC bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No clock ready interrupt caused by the LSE oscillator

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock ready interrupt caused by the LSE oscillator

BitField.name: HSIRDYF
BitField.description: HSI16 ready interrupt flag Set by hardware when the HSI16 clock becomes stable and HSIRDYDIE is set in a response to setting the HSION (refer to Clock control register (RCC_CR)). When HSION is not set but the HSI16 oscillator is enabled by the peripheral through a clock request, this bit is not set and no interrupt is generated. Cleared by software setting the HSIRDYC bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No clock ready interrupt caused by the HSI16 oscillator

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock ready interrupt caused by the HSI16 oscillator

BitField.name: HSERDYF
BitField.description: HSE ready interrupt flag Set by hardware when the HSE clock becomes stable and HSERDYDIE is set. Cleared by software setting the HSERDYC bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No clock ready interrupt caused by the HSE oscillator

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock ready interrupt caused by the HSE oscillator

BitField.name: PLLRDYF
BitField.description: PLL ready interrupt flag Set by hardware when the PLL locks and PLLRDYDIE is set. Cleared by software setting the PLLRDYC bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No clock ready interrupt caused by PLL lock

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock ready interrupt caused by PLL lock

BitField.name: CSSF
BitField.description: Clock security system interrupt flag Set by hardware when a failure is detected in the HSE oscillator. Cleared by software setting the CSSC bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No clock security interrupt caused by HSE clock failure

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock security interrupt caused by HSE clock failure

BitField.name: LSECSSF
BitField.description: LSE Clock security system interrupt flag Set by hardware when a failure is detected in the LSE oscillator. Cleared by software setting the LSECSSC bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No clock security interrupt caused by LSE clock failure

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock security interrupt caused by LSE clock failure

BitField.name: HSI48RDYF
BitField.description: HSI48 ready interrupt flag Set by hardware when the HSI48 clock becomes stable and HSI48RDYIE is set in a response to setting the HSI48ON (refer to Clock recovery RC register (RCC_CRRCR)). Cleared by software setting the HSI48RDYC bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No clock ready interrupt caused by the HSI48 oscillator

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock ready interrupt caused by the HSI48 oscillator

BitField.name: LSIRDYC
BitField.description: LSI ready interrupt clear This bit is set by software to clear the LSIRDYF flag.

BitField.name: LSERDYC
BitField.description: LSE ready interrupt clear This bit is set by software to clear the LSERDYF flag.

BitField.name: HSIRDYC
BitField.description: HSI16 ready interrupt clear This bit is set software to clear the HSIRDYF flag.

BitField.name: HSERDYC
BitField.description: HSE ready interrupt clear This bit is set by software to clear the HSERDYF flag.

BitField.name: PLLRDYC
BitField.description: PLL ready interrupt clear This bit is set by software to clear the PLLRDYF flag.

BitField.name: CSSC
BitField.description: Clock security system interrupt clear This bit is set by software to clear the CSSF flag.

BitField.name: LSECSSC
BitField.description: LSE Clock security system interrupt clear This bit is set by software to clear the LSECSSF flag.

BitField.name: HSI48RDYC
BitField.description: HSI48 oscillator ready interrupt clear This bit is set by software to clear the HSI48RDYF flag.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: System clock selected as ADC3/4/5 clock

BitField.name: LSEON
BitField.description: LSE oscillator enable Set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: LSERDY
BitField.description: LSE oscillator ready Set and cleared by hardware to indicate when the external 32 kHz oscillator is stable. After the LSEON bit is cleared, LSERDY goes low after 6 external low-speed oscillator clock cycles.

BitField.name: LSEBYP
BitField.description: LSE oscillator bypass Set and cleared by software to bypass oscillator in debug mode. This bit can be written only when the external 32 kHz oscillator is disabled (LSEON=0 and LSERDY=0).

BitField.name: LSEDRV
BitField.description: LSE oscillator drive capability Set by software to modulate the LSE oscillatorâ€™s drive capability. The oscillator is in Xtal mode when it is not in bypass mode.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: â€˜Xtal modeâ€™ medium low driving capability

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: â€˜Xtal modeâ€™ medium high driving capability

BitField.name: LSECSSON
BitField.description: CSS on LSE enable Set by software to enable the Clock Security System on LSE (32 kHz oscillator). LSECSSON must be enabled after the LSE oscillator is enabled (LSEON bit enabled) and ready (LSERDY flag set by hardware), and after the RTCSEL bit is selected. Once enabled this bit cannot be disabled, except after a LSE failure detection (LSECSSD =1). In that case the software MUST disable the LSECSSON bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CSS on LSE (32 kHz external oscillator) OFF

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSS on LSE (32 kHz external oscillator) ON

BitField.name: LSECSSD
BitField.description: CSS on LSE failure Detection Set by hardware to indicate when a failure has been detected by the Clock Security System on the external 32 kHz oscillator (LSE).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No failure detected on LSE (32 kHz oscillator)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Failure detected on LSE (32 kHz oscillator)

BitField.name: RTCSEL
BitField.description: RTC clock source selection Set by software to select the clock source for the RTC. Once the RTC clock source has been selected, it cannot be changed anymore unless the RTC domain is reset, or unless a failure is detected on LSE (LSECSSD is set). The BDRST bit can be used to reset them.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LSE oscillator clock used as RTC clock

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: LSI oscillator clock used as RTC clock

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: HSE oscillator clock divided by 32 used as RTC clock

BitField.name: RTCEN
BitField.description: RTC clock enable Set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BDRST
BitField.description: RTC domain software reset Set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: LSCOEN
BitField.description: Low speed clock output enable Set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: LSCOSEL
BitField.description: Low speed clock output selection Set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: LSION
BitField.description: LSI oscillator enable Set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: LSIRDY
BitField.description: LSI oscillator ready Set and cleared by hardware to indicate when the LSI oscillator is stable. After the LSION bit is cleared, LSIRDY goes low after 3 LSI oscillator clock cycles. This bit can be set even if LSION = 0 if the LSI is requested by the Clock Security System on LSE, by the Independent Watchdog or by the RTC.

BitField.name: RMVF
BitField.description: Remove reset flag Set by software to clear the reset flags.

BitField.name: OBLRSTF
BitField.description: Option byte loader reset flag Set by hardware when a reset from the Option Byte loading occurs. Cleared by writing to the RMVF bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No reset from Option Byte loading occurred

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Reset from Option Byte loading occurred

BitField.name: PINRSTF
BitField.description: Pin reset flag Set by hardware when a reset from the NRST pin occurs. Cleared by writing to the RMVF bit.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No reset from NRST pin occurred

BitField.name: BORRSTF
BitField.description: BOR flag Set by hardware when a BOR occurs. Cleared by writing to the RMVF bit.

BitField.name: SFTRSTF
BitField.description: Software reset flag Set by hardware when a software reset occurs. Cleared by writing to the RMVF bit.

BitField.name: IWDGRSTF
BitField.description: Independent window watchdog reset flag Set by hardware when an independent watchdog reset domain occurs. Cleared by writing to the RMVF bit.

BitField.name: WWDGRSTF
BitField.description: Window watchdog reset flag Set by hardware when a window watchdog reset occurs. Cleared by writing to the RMVF bit.

BitField.name: LPWRRSTF
BitField.description: Low-power reset flag Set by hardware when a reset occurs due to illegal Stop, Standby or Shutdown mode entry. Cleared by writing to the RMVF bit.

BitField.name: HSI48ON
BitField.description: HSI48 clock enable Set and cleared by software. Cleared by hardware to stop the HSI48 when entering in Stop, Standby or Shutdown modes.

BitField.name: HSI48RDY
BitField.description: HSI48 clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that HSI48 oscillator is stable. This bit is set only when HSI48 is enabled by software by setting HSI48ON.

BitField.name: HSI48CAL
BitField.description: HSI48 clock calibration These bits are initialized at startup with the factory-programmed HSI48 calibration trim value. They are ready only.

BitField.name: I2C4SEL
BitField.description: I2C4 clock source selection These bits are set and cleared by software to select the I2C4 clock source.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: System clock (SYSCLK) selected as I2C4 clock

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: HSI16 clock selected as I2C4 clock

BitField.name: QSPISEL
BitField.description: QUADSPI clock source selection Set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: system clock selected as QUADSPI kernel clock

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSI16 clock selected as QUADSPI kernel clock

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: PLL â€œQâ€ clock selected as QUADSPI kernel clock

BitField.name: LPMS
BitField.description: Low-power mode selection These bits select the low-power mode entered when CPU enters the deepsleep mode. 1xx: Shutdown mode Note: In Standby mode, SRAM2 can be preserved or not, depending on RRS bit configuration in PWR_CR3.

BitField.name: DBP
BitField.description: Disable backup domain write protection In reset state, the RTC and backup registers are protected against parasitic write access. This bit must be set to enable write access to these registers.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Access to RTC and Backup registers disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Access to RTC and Backup registers enabled

BitField.name: LPR
BitField.description: Low-power run When this bit is set, the regulator is switched from main mode (MR) to low-power mode (LPR).

BitField.name: PVDE
BitField.description: Programmable voltage detector enable Note: This bit is write-protected when the PVDL bit is set in the SYSCFG_CFGR2 register. The protection can be reset only by a system reset.

BitField.name: PVDLS
BitField.description: Programmable voltage detector level selection. These bits select the PVD falling threshold: Note: These bits are write-protected when the PVDL bit is set in the SYSCFG_CFGR2 register. The protection can be reset only by a system reset.

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: External input analog voltage PVD_IN (compared internally to V<sub>REFINT</sub>)

BitField.name: PVMEN1
BitField.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring 3 enable: V<sub>DDA</sub> vs. ADC/COMP min voltage 1.62V

BitField.name: PVMEN2
BitField.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring 4 enable: V<sub>DDA</sub> vs. DAC 1MSPS /DAC 15MSPS min voltage.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PVM2 (V<sub>DDA</sub> monitoring vs. 1.8 V threshold) disable.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PVM2 (V<sub>DDA</sub> monitoring vs. 1.8 V threshold) enable.

BitField.name: EWUP1
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup pin WKUP1 When this bit is set, the external wakeup pin WKUP1 is enabled and triggers a wakeup from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs. The active edge is configured via the WP1 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

BitField.name: EWUP2
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup pin WKUP2 When this bit is set, the external wakeup pin WKUP2 is enabled and triggers a wakeup from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs. The active edge is configured via the WP2 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

BitField.name: EWUP3
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup pin WKUP3 When this bit is set, the external wakeup pin WKUP3 is enabled and triggers a wakeup from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs. The active edge is configured via the WP3 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

BitField.name: EWUP4
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup pin WKUP4 When this bit is set, the external wakeup pin WKUP4 is enabled and triggers a wakeup from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs. The active edge is configured via the WP4 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

BitField.name: EWUP5
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup pin WKUP5 When this bit is set, the external wakeup pin WKUP5 is enabled and triggers a wakeup from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs.The active edge is configured via the WP5 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: SRAM2 is powered off in Standby mode (SRAM2 content is lost).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SRAM2 is powered by the low-power regulator in Standby mode (SRAM2 content is kept).

BitField.name: APC
BitField.description: Apply pull-up and pull-down configuration When this bit is set, the I/O pull-up and pull-down configurations defined in the PWR_PUCRx and PWR_PDCRx registers are applied. When this bit is cleared, the PWR_PUCRx and PWR_PDCRx registers are not applied to the I/Os.

BitField.name: UCPD1_STDBY
BitField.description: UCPD1_STDBY USB Type-C and Power Delivery standby mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Write â€˜0â€™ immediately after standby exit when using UCPD1, (and before writing any UCPD1 registers).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Write â€˜1â€™ just before entering standby when using UCPD1.

BitField.name: UCPD1_DBDIS
BitField.description: USB Type-C and Power Delivery Dead Battery disable. After exiting reset, the USB Type-C â€œdead batteryâ€ behavior is enabled, which may have a pull-down effect on CC1 and CC2 pins. It is recommended to disable it in all cases, either to stop this pull-down or to hand over control to the UCPD1 (which should therefore be initialized before doing the disable).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Enable USB Type-C dead battery pull-down behavior on UCPD1_CC1 and UCPD1_CC2 pins.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Disable USB Type-C dead battery pull-down behavior on UCPD1_CC1 and UCPD1_CC2 pins.

BitField.name: WP1
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUP1 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP1

BitField.name: WP2
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUP2 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP2

BitField.name: WP3
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUP3 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP3

BitField.name: WP4
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUP4 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP4

BitField.name: WP5
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUP5 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP5

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Charge V<sub>BAT</sub> through a 5 kOhms resistor

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Charge V<sub>BAT</sub> through a 1.5 kOhms resistor

BitField.name: WUF1
BitField.description: Wakeup flag 1 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on wakeup pin, WKUP1. It is cleared by writing â€˜1â€™ in the CWUF1 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

BitField.name: WUF2
BitField.description: Wakeup flag 2 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on wakeup pin, WKUP2. It is cleared by writing â€˜1â€™ in the CWUF2 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

BitField.name: WUF3
BitField.description: Wakeup flag 3 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on wakeup pin, WKUP3. It is cleared by writing â€˜1â€™ in the CWUF3 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

BitField.name: WUF4
BitField.description: Wakeup flag 4 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on wakeup pin,WKUP4. It is cleared by writing â€˜1â€™ in the CWUF4 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

BitField.name: WUF5
BitField.description: Wakeup flag 5 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on wakeup pin, WKUP5. It is cleared by writing â€˜1â€™ in the CWUF5 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

BitField.name: SBF
BitField.description: Standby flag This bit is set by hardware when the device enters the Standby mode and is cleared by setting the CSBF bit in the PWR_SCR register, or by a power-on reset. It is not cleared by the system reset.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The device did not enter the Standby mode

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The device entered the Standby mode

BitField.name: WUFI
BitField.description: Wakeup flag internal This bit is set when a wakeup is detected on the internal wakeup line. It is cleared when all internal wakeup sources are cleared.

BitField.name: REGLPS
BitField.description: Low-power regulator started This bit provides the information whether the low-power regulator is ready after a power-on reset or a Standby/Shutdown. If the Standby mode is entered while REGLPS bit is still cleared, the wakeup from Standby mode time may be increased.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The low-power regulator is not ready

BitField.name: REGLPF
BitField.description: Low-power regulator flag This bit is set by hardware when the MCU is in Low-power run mode. When the MCU exits the Low-power run mode, this bit remains at 1 until the regulator is ready in main mode. A polling on this bit must be done before increasing the product frequency. This bit is cleared by hardware when the regulator is ready.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The regulator is ready in main mode (MR)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The regulator is in low-power mode (LPR)

BitField.name: VOSF
BitField.description: Voltage scaling flag A delay is required for the internal regulator to be ready after the voltage scaling has been changed. VOSF indicates that the regulator reached the voltage level defined with VOS bits of the PWR_CR1 register.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The regulator is ready in the selected voltage range

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The regulator output voltage is changing to the required voltage level

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: V<sub>DD</sub> is above the selected PVD threshold

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: V<sub>DD</sub> is below the selected PVD threshold

BitField.name: PVMO1
BitField.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring output: V<sub>DDA</sub> vs. 1.62 V Note: PVMO1 is cleared when PVM1 is disabled (PVME = 0). After enabling PVM1, the PVM1 output is valid after the PVM1 wakeup time.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: V<sub>DDA</sub> voltage is above PVM1 threshold (around 1.62 V).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: V<sub>DDA</sub> voltage is below PVM1 threshold (around 1.62 V).

BitField.name: PVMO2
BitField.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring output: V<sub>DDA</sub> vs. 1.8 V Note: PVMO2 is cleared when PVM2 is disabled (PVME = 0). After enabling PVM2, the PVM2 output is valid after the PVM2 wakeup time.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: V<sub>DDA</sub> voltage is above PVM2 threshold (around 1.8 V).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: V<sub>DDA</sub> voltage is below PVM2 threshold (around 1.8 V).

BitField.name: CWUF1
BitField.description: Clear wakeup flag 1 Setting this bit clears the WUF1 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

BitField.name: CWUF2
BitField.description: Clear wakeup flag 2 Setting this bit clears the WUF2 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

BitField.name: CWUF3
BitField.description: Clear wakeup flag 3 Setting this bit clears the WUF3 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

BitField.name: CWUF4
BitField.description: Clear wakeup flag 4 Setting this bit clears the WUF4 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

BitField.name: CWUF5
BitField.description: Clear wakeup flag 5 Setting this bit clears the WUF5 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

BitField.name: CSBF
BitField.description: Clear standby flag Setting this bit clears the SBF flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

Register.name: C0CR
Register.description: DMAMux - DMA request line multiplexer channel x control register

BitField.name: SOIE
BitField.description: Interrupt enable at synchronization event overrun

BitField.name: SPOL
BitField.description: Synchronization event type selector Defines the synchronization event on the selected synchronization input:

BitField.name: NBREQ
BitField.description: Number of DMA requests to forward Defines the number of DMA requests forwarded before output event is generated. In synchronous mode, it also defines the number of DMA requests to forward after a synchronization event, then stop forwarding. The actual number of DMA requests forwarded is NBREQ+1. Note: This field can only be written when both SE and EGE bits are reset.

Register.name: RG0CR
Register.description: DMAMux - DMA request generator channel x control register

BitField.name: OIE
BitField.description: Interrupt enable at trigger event overrun

BitField.name: GPOL
BitField.description: DMA request generator trigger event type selection Defines the trigger event on the selected DMA request trigger input

BitField.name: GNBREQ
BitField.description: Number of DMA requests to generate Defines the number of DMA requests generated after a trigger event, then stop generating. The actual number of generated DMA requests is GNBREQ+1. Note: This field can only be written when GE bit is reset.

Register.name: RGSR
Register.description: DMAMux - DMA request generator status register

BitField.name: OF
BitField.description: Trigger event overrun flag The flag is set when a trigger event occurs on DMA request generator channel x, while the DMA request generator counter value is lower than GNBREQ. The flag is cleared by writing 1 to the corresponding COFx bit in DMAMUX_RGCFR register.

Register.name: RGCFR
Register.description: DMAMux - DMA request generator clear flag register

BitField.name: COF
BitField.description: Clear trigger event overrun flag Upon setting, this bit clears the corresponding overrun flag OFx in the DMAMUX_RGCSR register.

Register.name: CSR
Register.description: DMAMUX request line multiplexer interrupt channel status register

Register.name: CFR
Register.description: DMAMUX request line multiplexer interrupt clear flag register

BitField.name: ANASWVDD
BitField.description: GPIO analog switch control voltage selection

Register.name: SCSR
Register.description: CCM SRAM control and status register

BitField.name: CCMBSY
BitField.description: CCM SRAM busy by erase operation

BitField.name: HIZ
BitField.description: High impedence mode for the VREF_BUF

BitField.name: EN1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel1.

BitField.name: TSEL1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 trigger selection These bits select the external event used to trigger DAC channel1. Note: Only used if bit TEN1 = 1 (DAC channel1 trigger enabled).

BitField.name: WAVE1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 noise/triangle wave generation enable These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: Only used if bit TEN1 = 1 (DAC channel1 trigger enabled).

BitField.name: MAMP1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 mask/amplitude selector These bits are written by software to select mask in wave generation mode or amplitude in triangle generation mode. = 1011: Unmask bits[11:0] of LFSR/ triangle amplitude equal to 4095

BitField.name: DMAEN1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 DMA enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: DMAUDRIE1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 DMA Underrun Interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CEN1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 calibration enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel 1 calibration, it can be written only if bit EN1=0 into DAC_CR (the calibration mode can be entered/exit only when the DAC channel is disabled) Otherwise, the write operation is ignored.

BitField.name: EN2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel2.

BitField.name: TSEL2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 trigger selection These bits select the external event used to trigger DAC channel2 Note: Only used if bit TEN2 = 1 (DAC channel2 trigger enabled).

BitField.name: WAVE2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 noise/triangle wave generation enable These bits are set/reset by software. 1x: Triangle wave generation enabled Note: Only used if bit TEN2 = 1 (DAC channel2 trigger enabled)

BitField.name: MAMP2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 mask/amplitude selector These bits are written by software to select mask in wave generation mode or amplitude in triangle generation mode. = 1011: Unmask bits[11:0] of LFSR/ triangle amplitude equal to 4095

BitField.name: DMAEN2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 DMA enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: DMAUDRIE2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 DMA underrun interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CEN2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 calibration enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel 2 calibration, it can be written only if bit EN2=0 into DAC_CR (the calibration mode can be entered/exit only when the DAC channel is disabled) Otherwise, the write operation is ignored.

BitField.name: SWTRIG1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 software trigger This bit is set by software to trigger the DAC in software trigger mode. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware (one APB1 clock cycle later) once the DAC_DHR1 register value has been loaded into the DAC_DOR1 register.

BitField.name: SWTRIG2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 software trigger This bit is set by software to trigger the DAC in software trigger mode. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware (one APB1 clock cycle later) once the DAC_DHR2 register value has been loaded into the DAC_DOR2 register.

BitField.description: DAC channel1 8-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 8-bit data for DAC channel1.

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 8-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 8-bit data for DAC channel2.

BitField.name: DACC1DOR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 data output These bits are read-only, they contain data output for DAC channel1.

BitField.name: DACC2DOR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 data output These bits are read-only, they contain data output for DAC channel2.

BitField.name: DORSTAT1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 output register status bit

BitField.name: DMAUDR1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 DMA underrun flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared by software (by writing it to 1).

BitField.name: CAL_FLAG1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 calibration offset status This bit is set and cleared by hardware

BitField.name: BWST1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 busy writing sample time flag This bit is systematically set just after Sample & Hold mode enable and is set each time the software writes the register DAC_SHSR1, It is cleared by hardware when the write operation of DAC_SHSR1 is complete. (It takes about 3LSI periods of synchronization).

BitField.name: DORSTAT2
BitField.description: DAC channel 2 output register status bit

BitField.name: DMAUDR2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 DMA underrun flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared by software (by writing it to 1).

BitField.name: CAL_FLAG2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 calibration offset status This bit is set and cleared by hardware

BitField.name: BWST2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 busy writing sample time flag This bit is systematically set just after Sample & Hold mode enable and is set each time the software writes the register DAC_SHSR2, It is cleared by hardware when the write operation of DAC_SHSR2 is complete. (It takes about 3 LSI periods of synchronization).

BitField.name: MODE1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 mode These bits can be written only when the DAC is disabled and not in the calibration mode (when bit EN1=0 and bit CEN1 =0 in the DAC_CR register). If EN1=1 or CEN1 =1 the write operation is ignored. They can be set and cleared by software to select the DAC Channel 1 mode: DAC Channel 1 in normal Mode DAC Channel 1 in sample & hold mode

BitField.name: DMADOUBLE1
BitField.description: DAC Channel1 DMA double data mode

BitField.name: SINFORMAT1
BitField.description: Enable signed format for DAC channel1

BitField.name: MODE2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 mode These bits can be written only when the DAC is disabled and not in the calibration mode (when bit EN2=0 and bit CEN2 =0 in the DAC_CR register). If EN2=1 or CEN2 =1 the write operation is ignored. They can be set and cleared by software to select the DAC Channel 2 mode: DAC Channel 2 in normal Mode DAC Channel 2 in sample & hold mode

BitField.name: DMADOUBLE2
BitField.description: DAC Channel2 DMA double data mode

BitField.name: SINFORMAT2
BitField.description: Enable signed format for DAC channel2

Register.name: DAC_SHSR1
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold sample time register 1

BitField.name: TSAMPLE1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 sample Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) These bits can be written when the DAC channel1 is disabled or also during normal operation. in the latter case, the write can be done only when BWSTx of DAC_SR register is low, If BWSTx=1, the write operation is ignored.

Register.name: DAC_SHSR2
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold sample time register 2

BitField.name: TSAMPLE2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 sample Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) These bits can be written when the DAC channel2 is disabled or also during normal operation. in the latter case, the write can be done only when BWSTx of DAC_SR register is low, if BWSTx=1, the write operation is ignored.

Register.name: DAC_SHHR
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold hold time register

BitField.name: THOLD1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 hold Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) Hold time= (THOLD[9:0]) x T LSI

BitField.name: THOLD2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 hold time (only valid in sample & hold mode). Hold time= (THOLD[9:0]) x T LSI

Register.name: DAC_SHRR
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold refresh time register

BitField.name: TREFRESH1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 refresh Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) Refresh time= (TREFRESH[7:0]) x T LSI

BitField.name: TREFRESH2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 refresh Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) Refresh time= (TREFRESH[7:0]) x T LSI

BitField.name: DMADOUBLE1
BitField.description: DAC Channel1 DMA double data mode

BitField.name: SINFORMAT1
BitField.description: Enable signed format for DAC channel1

BitField.name: MODE2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 mode These bits can be written only when the DAC is disabled and not in the calibration mode (when bit EN2=0 and bit CEN2 =0 in the DAC_CR register). If EN2=1 or CEN2 =1 the write operation is ignored. They can be set and cleared by software to select the DAC Channel 2 mode: DAC Channel 2 in normal Mode DAC Channel 2 in sample & hold mode

BitField.name: DMADOUBLE2
BitField.description: DAC Channel2 DMA double data mode

BitField.name: SINFORMAT2
BitField.description: Enable signed format for DAC channel2

Register.name: DAC_SHSR1
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold sample time register 1

BitField.name: TSAMPLE1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 sample Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) These bits can be written when the DAC channel1 is disabled or also during normal operation. in the latter case, the write can be done only when BWSTx of DAC_SR register is low, If BWSTx=1, the write operation is ignored.

Register.name: DAC_SHSR2
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold sample time register 2

BitField.name: TSAMPLE2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 sample Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) These bits can be written when the DAC channel2 is disabled or also during normal operation. in the latter case, the write can be done only when BWSTx of DAC_SR register is low, if BWSTx=1, the write operation is ignored.

Register.name: DAC_SHHR
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold hold time register

BitField.name: THOLD1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 hold Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) Hold time= (THOLD[9:0]) x T LSI

BitField.name: THOLD2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 hold time (only valid in sample & hold mode). Hold time= (THOLD[9:0]) x T LSI

Register.name: DAC_SHRR
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold refresh time register

BitField.name: TREFRESH1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 refresh Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) Refresh time= (TREFRESH[7:0]) x T LSI

BitField.name: TREFRESH2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 refresh Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) Refresh time= (TREFRESH[7:0]) x T LSI

BitField.name: STINCDATA1
BitField.description: DAC CH1 Sawtooth increment value (12.4 bit format)

BitField.name: STINCDATA2
BitField.description: DAC CH2 Sawtooth increment value (12.4 bit format)

BitField.name: STRSTTRIGSEL1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 Sawtooth Reset trigger selection

BitField.name: STINCTRIGSEL1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 Sawtooth Increment trigger selection

BitField.name: STRSTTRIGSEL2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 Sawtooth Reset trigger selection

BitField.name: STINCTRIGSEL2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 Sawtooth Increment trigger selection

BitField.name: EN1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel1.

BitField.name: TSEL1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 trigger selection These bits select the external event used to trigger DAC channel1. Note: Only used if bit TEN1 = 1 (DAC channel1 trigger enabled).

BitField.name: WAVE1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 noise/triangle wave generation enable These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: Only used if bit TEN1 = 1 (DAC channel1 trigger enabled).

BitField.name: MAMP1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 mask/amplitude selector These bits are written by software to select mask in wave generation mode or amplitude in triangle generation mode. = 1011: Unmask bits[11:0] of LFSR/ triangle amplitude equal to 4095

BitField.name: DMAEN1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 DMA enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: DMAUDRIE1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 DMA Underrun Interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CEN1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 calibration enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel 1 calibration, it can be written only if bit EN1=0 into DAC_CR (the calibration mode can be entered/exit only when the DAC channel is disabled) Otherwise, the write operation is ignored.

BitField.name: EN2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel2.

BitField.name: TSEL2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 trigger selection These bits select the external event used to trigger DAC channel2 Note: Only used if bit TEN2 = 1 (DAC channel2 trigger enabled).

BitField.name: WAVE2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 noise/triangle wave generation enable These bits are set/reset by software. 1x: Triangle wave generation enabled Note: Only used if bit TEN2 = 1 (DAC channel2 trigger enabled)

BitField.name: MAMP2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 mask/amplitude selector These bits are written by software to select mask in wave generation mode or amplitude in triangle generation mode. = 1011: Unmask bits[11:0] of LFSR/ triangle amplitude equal to 4095

BitField.name: DMAEN2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 DMA enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: DMAUDRIE2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 DMA underrun interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CEN2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 calibration enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel 2 calibration, it can be written only if bit EN2=0 into DAC_CR (the calibration mode can be entered/exit only when the DAC channel is disabled) Otherwise, the write operation is ignored.

BitField.name: SWTRIG1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 software trigger This bit is set by software to trigger the DAC in software trigger mode. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware (one APB1 clock cycle later) once the DAC_DHR1 register value has been loaded into the DAC_DOR1 register.

BitField.name: SWTRIG2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 software trigger This bit is set by software to trigger the DAC in software trigger mode. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware (one APB1 clock cycle later) once the DAC_DHR2 register value has been loaded into the DAC_DOR2 register.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12R1
Register.description: DAC channel1 12-bit right-aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC1DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 12-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel1.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12L1
Register.description: DAC channel1 12-bit left aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC1DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 12-bit left-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel1.

BitField.description: DAC channel2 12-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel2.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12L2

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 12-bit left-aligned data These bits are written by software which specify 12-bit data for DAC channel2.

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 8-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 8-bit data for DAC channel2.

BitField.description: DAC channel1 12-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel1.

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 12-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel2.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12LD
Register.description: DUAL DAC 12-bit left aligned data holding register

BitField.description: DAC channel1 12-bit left-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel1.

BitField.description: DAC channel2 12-bit left-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel2.

BitField.description: DAC channel2 8-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 8-bit data for DAC channel2.

BitField.description: DAC channel1 data output These bits are read-only, they contain data output for DAC channel1.

BitField.name: DACC2DOR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 data output These bits are read-only, they contain data output for DAC channel2.

BitField.name: DORSTAT1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 output register status bit

BitField.name: DMAUDR1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 DMA underrun flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared by software (by writing it to 1).

BitField.name: CAL_FLAG1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 calibration offset status This bit is set and cleared by hardware

BitField.name: BWST1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 busy writing sample time flag This bit is systematically set just after Sample & Hold mode enable and is set each time the software writes the register DAC_SHSR1, It is cleared by hardware when the write operation of DAC_SHSR1 is complete. (It takes about 3LSI periods of synchronization).

BitField.name: DORSTAT2
BitField.description: DAC channel 2 output register status bit

BitField.name: DMAUDR2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 DMA underrun flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared by software (by writing it to 1).

BitField.name: CAL_FLAG2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 calibration offset status This bit is set and cleared by hardware

BitField.name: BWST2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 busy writing sample time flag This bit is systematically set just after Sample & Hold mode enable and is set each time the software writes the register DAC_SHSR2, It is cleared by hardware when the write operation of DAC_SHSR2 is complete. (It takes about 3 LSI periods of synchronization).

Register.name: DBTP
Register.description: This register is only writable if bits CCCR.CCE and CCCR.INIT are set. The CAN bit time may be programed in the range of 4 to 25 time quanta. The CAN time quantum may be programmed in the range of 1 to 1024 FDCAN clock periods. tq = (DBRP + 1) FDCAN clock period. DTSEG1 is the sum of Prop_Seg and Phase_Seg1. DTSEG2 is Phase_Seg2. Therefore the length of the bit time is (programmed values) [DTSEG1 + DTSEG2 + 3] tq or (functional values) [Sync_Seg + Prop_Seg + Phase_Seg1 + Phase_Seg2] tq. The Information Processing Time (IPT) is zero, meaning the data for the next bit is available at the first clock edge after the sample point.

Register.name: TEST
Register.description: Write access to the Test Register has to be enabled by setting bit CCCR[TEST] to 1 . All Test Register functions are set to their reset values when bit CCCR[TEST] is reset. Loop Back mode and software control of Tx pin FDCANx_TX are hardware test modes. Programming TX differently from 00 may disturb the message transfer on the CAN bus.

Register.name: RWD
Register.description: The RAM Watchdog monitors the READY output of the Message RAM. A Message RAM access starts the Message RAM Watchdog Counter with the value configured by the RWD[WDC] bits. The counter is reloaded with RWD[WDC] bits when the Message RAM signals successful completion by activating its READY output. In case there is no response from the Message RAM until the counter has counted down to 0, the counter stops and interrupt flag IR[WDI] bit is set. The RAM Watchdog Counter is clocked by the fdcan_pclk clock.

Register.name: CCCR
Register.description: For details about setting and resetting of single bits see Software initialization.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: The flags are set when one of the listed conditions is detected (edge-sensitive). The flags remain set until the Host clears them. A flag is cleared by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit position. Writing a 0 has no effect. A hard reset will clear the register. The configuration of IE controls whether an interrupt is generated. The configuration of ILS controls on which interrupt line an interrupt is signaled.

Register.name: IE
Register.description: The settings in the Interrupt Enable register determine which status changes in the Interrupt Register will be signaled on an interrupt line.

Register.name: ILS
Register.description: The Interrupt Line Select register assigns an interrupt generated by a specific interrupt flag from the Interrupt Register to one of the two module interrupt lines. For interrupt generation the respective interrupt line has to be enabled via ILE[EINT0] and ILE[EINT1].

Register.name: ILE
Register.description: Each of the two interrupt lines to the CPU can be enabled/disabled separately by programming bits EINT0 and EINT1.

Register.name: RXGFC
Register.description: Global settings for Message ID filtering. The Global Filter Configuration controls the filter path for standard and extended messages as described in Figure706: Standard Message ID filter path and Figure707: Extended Message ID filter path.

Register.name: XIDAM
Register.description: FDCAN Extended ID and Mask Register

Register.name: HPMS
Register.description: This register is updated every time a Message ID filter element configured to generate a priority event match. This can be used to monitor the status of incoming high priority messages and to enable fast access to these messages.

Register.name: TXFQS
Register.description: The Tx FIFO/Queue status is related to the pending Tx requests listed in register TXBRP. Therefore the effect of Add/Cancellation requests may be delayed due to a running Tx scan (TXBRP not yet updated).

Register.name: TXBRP
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Request Pending Register

Register.name: TXBAR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Add Request Register

Register.name: TXBCR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Request Register

Register.name: TXBTO
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Transmission Occurred Register

Register.name: TXBCF
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Finished Register

Register.name: TXBTIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Transmission Interrupt Enable Register

Register.name: TXBCIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Finished Interrupt Enable Register

Register.name: TXEFS
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Event FIFO Status Register

Register.name: TXEFA
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Event FIFO Acknowledge Register

BitField.name: PDIV
BitField.description: input clock divider. the APB clock could be divided prior to be used by the CAN sub

Register.name: ILS
Register.description: The Interrupt Line Select register assigns an interrupt generated by a specific interrupt flag from the Interrupt Register to one of the two module interrupt lines. For interrupt generation the respective interrupt line has to be enabled via ILE[EINT0] and ILE[EINT1].

Register.name: ILE
Register.description: Each of the two interrupt lines to the CPU can be enabled/disabled separately by programming bits EINT0 and EINT1.

Register.name: RXGFC
Register.description: Global settings for Message ID filtering. The Global Filter Configuration controls the filter path for standard and extended messages as described in Figure706: Standard Message ID filter path and Figure707: Extended Message ID filter path.

Register.name: XIDAM
Register.description: FDCAN Extended ID and Mask Register

Register.name: HPMS
Register.description: This register is updated every time a Message ID filter element configured to generate a priority event match. This can be used to monitor the status of incoming high priority messages and to enable fast access to these messages.

Register.name: TXFQS
Register.description: The Tx FIFO/Queue status is related to the pending Tx requests listed in register TXBRP. Therefore the effect of Add/Cancellation requests may be delayed due to a running Tx scan (TXBRP not yet updated).

Register.name: TXBRP
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Request Pending Register

Register.name: TXBAR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Add Request Register

Register.name: TXBCR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Request Register

Register.name: TXBTO
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Transmission Occurred Register

Register.name: TXBCF
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Finished Register

Register.name: TXBTIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Transmission Interrupt Enable Register

Register.name: TXBCIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Finished Interrupt Enable Register

Register.name: TXEFS
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Event FIFO Status Register

Register.name: TXEFA
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Event FIFO Acknowledge Register

BitField.name: PDIV
BitField.description: input clock divider. the APB clock could be divided prior to be used by the CAN sub

Register.name: DBTP
Register.description: This register is only writable if bits CCCR.CCE and CCCR.INIT are set. The CAN bit time may be programed in the range of 4 to 25 time quanta. The CAN time quantum may be programmed in the range of 1 to 1024 FDCAN clock periods. tq = (DBRP + 1) FDCAN clock period. DTSEG1 is the sum of Prop_Seg and Phase_Seg1. DTSEG2 is Phase_Seg2. Therefore the length of the bit time is (programmed values) [DTSEG1 + DTSEG2 + 3] tq or (functional values) [Sync_Seg + Prop_Seg + Phase_Seg1 + Phase_Seg2] tq. The Information Processing Time (IPT) is zero, meaning the data for the next bit is available at the first clock edge after the sample point.

Register.name: TEST
Register.description: Write access to the Test Register has to be enabled by setting bit CCCR[TEST] to 1 . All Test Register functions are set to their reset values when bit CCCR[TEST] is reset. Loop Back mode and software control of Tx pin FDCANx_TX are hardware test modes. Programming TX differently from 00 may disturb the message transfer on the CAN bus.

Register.name: RWD
Register.description: The RAM Watchdog monitors the READY output of the Message RAM. A Message RAM access starts the Message RAM Watchdog Counter with the value configured by the RWD[WDC] bits. The counter is reloaded with RWD[WDC] bits when the Message RAM signals successful completion by activating its READY output. In case there is no response from the Message RAM until the counter has counted down to 0, the counter stops and interrupt flag IR[WDI] bit is set. The RAM Watchdog Counter is clocked by the fdcan_pclk clock.

Register.name: CCCR
Register.description: For details about setting and resetting of single bits see Software initialization.

Register.name: IR
Register.description: The flags are set when one of the listed conditions is detected (edge-sensitive). The flags remain set until the Host clears them. A flag is cleared by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit position. Writing a 0 has no effect. A hard reset will clear the register. The configuration of IE controls whether an interrupt is generated. The configuration of ILS controls on which interrupt line an interrupt is signaled.

Register.name: IE
Register.description: The settings in the Interrupt Enable register determine which status changes in the Interrupt Register will be signaled on an interrupt line.

Register.name: ILS
Register.description: The Interrupt Line Select register assigns an interrupt generated by a specific interrupt flag from the Interrupt Register to one of the two module interrupt lines. For interrupt generation the respective interrupt line has to be enabled via ILE[EINT0] and ILE[EINT1].

Register.name: ILE
Register.description: Each of the two interrupt lines to the CPU can be enabled/disabled separately by programming bits EINT0 and EINT1.

Register.name: RXGFC
Register.description: Global settings for Message ID filtering. The Global Filter Configuration controls the filter path for standard and extended messages as described in Figure706: Standard Message ID filter path and Figure707: Extended Message ID filter path.

Register.name: XIDAM
Register.description: FDCAN Extended ID and Mask Register

Register.name: HPMS
Register.description: This register is updated every time a Message ID filter element configured to generate a priority event match. This can be used to monitor the status of incoming high priority messages and to enable fast access to these messages.

Register.name: TXFQS
Register.description: The Tx FIFO/Queue status is related to the pending Tx requests listed in register TXBRP. Therefore the effect of Add/Cancellation requests may be delayed due to a running Tx scan (TXBRP not yet updated).

Register.name: TXBRP
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Request Pending Register

Register.name: TXBAR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Add Request Register

Register.name: TXBCR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Request Register

Register.name: TXBTO
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Transmission Occurred Register

Register.name: TXBCF
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Finished Register

Register.name: TXBTIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Transmission Interrupt Enable Register

Register.name: TXBCIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Finished Interrupt Enable Register

Register.name: TXEFS
Register.description: FDCAN Tx Event FIFO Status Register

Register.description: FDCAN Tx Event FIFO Acknowledge Register

BitField.name: PDIV
BitField.description: input clock divider. the APB clock could be divided prior to be used by the CAN sub

Register.name: TX_ORDSET
Register.description: UCPD Tx Ordered Set Type Register

Register.name: RX_ORDEXT1
Register.description: UCPD Rx Ordered Set Extension Register 1

Register.name: RX_ORDEXT2
Register.description: UCPD Rx Ordered Set Extension Register 2

BitField.name: ERRIE
BitField.description: Synchronization or trimming error interrupt enable

BitField.name: CEN
BitField.description: Frequency error counter enable This bit enables the oscillator clock for the frequency error counter. When this bit is set, the CRS_CFGR register is write-protected and cannot be modified.

BitField.name: AUTOTRIMEN
BitField.description: Automatic trimming enable This bit enables the automatic hardware adjustment of TRIM bits according to the measured frequency error between two SYNC events. If this bit is set, the TRIM bits are read-only. The TRIM value can be adjusted by hardware by one or two steps at a time, depending on the measured frequency error value. Refer to Section7.3.4: Frequency error evaluation and automatic trimming for more details.

BitField.name: SWSYNC
BitField.description: Generate software SYNC event This bit is set by software in order to generate a software SYNC event. It is automatically cleared by hardware.

BitField.name: TRIM
BitField.description: HSI48 oscillator smooth trimming These bits provide a user-programmable trimming value to the HSI48 oscillator. They can be programmed to adjust to variations in voltage and temperature that influence the frequency of the HSI48. The default value is 32, which corresponds to the middle of the trimming interval. The trimming step is around 67 kHz between two consecutive TRIM steps. A higher TRIM value corresponds to a higher output frequency. When the AUTOTRIMEN bit is set, this field is controlled by hardware and is read-only.

Register.name: CFGR
Register.description: This register can be written only when the frequency error counter is disabled (CEN bit is cleared in CRS_CR). When the counter is enabled, this register is write-protected.

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Counter reload value RELOAD is the value to be loaded in the frequency error counter with each SYNC event. Refer to Section7.3.3: Frequency error measurement for more details about counter behavior.

BitField.name: FELIM
BitField.description: Frequency error limit FELIM contains the value to be used to evaluate the captured frequency error value latched in the FECAP[15:0] bits of the CRS_ISR register. Refer to Section7.3.4: Frequency error evaluation and automatic trimming for more details about FECAP evaluation.

BitField.name: SYNCDIV
BitField.description: SYNC divider These bits are set and cleared by software to control the division factor of the SYNC signal.

BitField.name: SYNCSRC
BitField.description: SYNC signal source selection These bits are set and cleared by software to select the SYNC signal source. Note: When using USB LPM (Link Power Management) and the device is in Sleep mode, the periodic USB SOF will not be generated by the host. No SYNC signal will therefore be provided to the CRS to calibrate the HSI48 on the run. To guarantee the required clock precision after waking up from Sleep mode, the LSE or reference clock on the GPIOs should be used as SYNC signal.

BitField.name: SYNCPOL
BitField.description: SYNC polarity selection This bit is set and cleared by software to select the input polarity for the SYNC signal source.

BitField.name: SYNCOKF
BitField.description: SYNC event OK flag This flag is set by hardware when the measured frequency error is smaller than FELIM * 3. This means that either no adjustment of the TRIM value is needed or that an adjustment by one trimming step is enough to compensate the frequency error. An interrupt is generated if the SYNCOKIE bit is set in the CRS_CR register. It is cleared by software by setting the SYNCOKC bit in the CRS_ICR register.

BitField.name: SYNCWARNF
BitField.description: SYNC warning flag This flag is set by hardware when the measured frequency error is greater than or equal to FELIM * 3, but smaller than FELIM * 128. This means that to compensate the frequency error, the TRIM value must be adjusted by two steps or more. An interrupt is generated if the SYNCWARNIE bit is set in the CRS_CR register. It is cleared by software by setting the SYNCWARNC bit in the CRS_ICR register.

BitField.name: ERRF
BitField.description: Error flag This flag is set by hardware in case of any synchronization or trimming error. It is the logical OR of the TRIMOVF, SYNCMISS and SYNCERR bits. An interrupt is generated if the ERRIE bit is set in the CRS_CR register. It is cleared by software in reaction to setting the ERRC bit in the CRS_ICR register, which clears the TRIMOVF, SYNCMISS and SYNCERR bits.

BitField.name: ESYNCF
BitField.description: Expected SYNC flag This flag is set by hardware when the frequency error counter reached a zero value. An interrupt is generated if the ESYNCIE bit is set in the CRS_CR register. It is cleared by software by setting the ESYNCC bit in the CRS_ICR register.

BitField.name: SYNCERR
BitField.description: SYNC error This flag is set by hardware when the SYNC pulse arrives before the ESYNC event and the measured frequency error is greater than or equal to FELIM * 128. This means that the frequency error is too big (internal frequency too low) to be compensated by adjusting the TRIM value, and that some other action should be taken. An interrupt is generated if the ERRIE bit is set in the CRS_CR register. It is cleared by software by setting the ERRC bit in the CRS_ICR register.

BitField.name: SYNCMISS
BitField.description: SYNC missed This flag is set by hardware when the frequency error counter reached value FELIM * 128 and no SYNC was detected, meaning either that a SYNC pulse was missed or that the frequency error is too big (internal frequency too high) to be compensated by adjusting the TRIM value, and that some other action should be taken. At this point, the frequency error counter is stopped (waiting for a next SYNC) and an interrupt is generated if the ERRIE bit is set in the CRS_CR register. It is cleared by software by setting the ERRC bit in the CRS_ICR register.

BitField.name: TRIMOVF
BitField.description: Trimming overflow or underflow This flag is set by hardware when the automatic trimming tries to over- or under-flow the TRIM value. An interrupt is generated if the ERRIE bit is set in the CRS_CR register. It is cleared by software by setting the ERRC bit in the CRS_ICR register.

BitField.name: FEDIR
BitField.description: Frequency error direction FEDIR is the counting direction of the frequency error counter latched in the time of the last SYNC event. It shows whether the actual frequency is below or above the target.

BitField.name: FECAP
BitField.description: Frequency error capture FECAP is the frequency error counter value latched in the time ofthe last SYNC event. Refer to Section7.3.4: Frequency error evaluation and automatic trimming for more details about FECAP usage.

BitField.name: SYNCOKC
BitField.description: SYNC event OK clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the SYNCOKF flag in the CRS_ISR register.

BitField.name: SYNCWARNC
BitField.description: SYNC warning clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the SYNCWARNF flag in the CRS_ISR register.

BitField.name: ERRC
BitField.description: Error clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears TRIMOVF, SYNCMISS and SYNCERR bits and consequently also the ERRF flag in the CRS_ISR register.

BitField.name: ESYNCC
BitField.description: Expected SYNC clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the ESYNCF flag in the CRS_ISR register.

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors

BitField.name: INTLINESNUM
BitField.description: The total number of interrupt lines supported by an implementation, defined in groups of 32.

BitField.name: DISOOFP
BitField.description: Disables floating pointinstructions completing outof order with respect to integer instructions

BitField.name: DISFPCA
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables IT folding

BitField.name: DISFOLD
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISMCYCINT
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables interruption of load multiple and store multiple instructions

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: MMARVALID
BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: MLSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: MUNSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals

BitField.name: ADDRESSS
BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame

BitField.name: IREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU instruction regions

BitField.name: DREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU data regions

BitField.name: SEPARATE
BitField.description: Support for unified or separate instruction and date memory maps

BitField.name: PRIVDEFENA
BitField.description: Enables privileged software access to the default memory map

BitField.name: HFNMIENA
BitField.description: Enable the operation of MPU during hard fault, NMI, and FAULTMASK handlers

BitField.name: REGION
BitField.description: Indicates the MPU region referenced by the MPU_RBAR and MPU_RASR registers

Register.name: MPU_RASR
Register.description: MPU Region Attribute and Size Register
